item.title: Vietnam is cutting 1 in 5 government jobs as top leader targets ‘safe havens for weak officials’
item.description: "If we want to have a healthy body, sometimes we must take bitter medicine and endure pain to remove tumors," top leader To Lam said in December.

item.title: Singapore buys only small amount of Nvidia chips, official says
item.description: Trump officials are probing whether China's DeepSeek bought advanced Nvidia semiconductors through third parties in Singapore.

item.title: France bans prison activities like country dancing and facial massages—former minister insists only education-focused programs should remain
item.description: "We must now completely stop these activities, whose existence no one understands," Gerald Darmanin, a former interior minister said.

item.title: ‘If parents have dinner, the kids have to sit at another table’: German defense boss says Europe has itself to blame for being cut out of Ukraine talks
item.description: European NATO members' repeated failure to hit its defense spending targets means it should have no complaints about peace talks, Rheinmetall CEO says...

item.title: Europe refuses to delay Meta and Apple antitrust decisions, despite pressure from the U.S.
item.description: The issue of tech regulation has become central to the U.S.-EU trade confrontation.
